abstract: The Dow fell to its lowest level since April on a day when oil prices moved near the symbolic $100 level.
snippet: The Dow fell to its lowest level since April on a day when oil prices moved near the symbolic $100 level.
lead_paragraph: A late sell-off in the final minutes of trading sent stocks down sharply today, with the Dow Jones industrial average closing at its lowest level since April. The Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index, a broad measure of the equity market, fell into negative territory for the year.

headline.main: Stocks Fall as Oil Flirts With $100 a Barrel
